headers.subject: Re: Upgrade: Breezy to Dapper
headers.received: by fmmailgate02.web.de (8.12.10/8.12.10/webde Linux 0.7) with ESMTP id k3RHmCr6022916 for <ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com>; Thu, 27 Apr 2006 19:48:12 +0200

from [84.175.22.76] (helo=ubuntu.mynet.home) by smtp06.web.de with esmtp (TLSv1:EXP1024-RC4-SHA:128) (WEB.DE 4.107 #108) id 1FZAb4-0007k4-00 for ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com; Thu, 27 Apr 2006 19:48:10 +0200
headers.reply-to: ggrubbish@web.de, Ubuntu Help and User Discussions <ubuntu-users@lists.ubuntu.com>

quote.quotepara: Yes, I'm affraid my nightmare happen again. When I upgrade from Hoary to Breezy, all looks same only number of version changed. nothing special. but when I install breezy (clean install) I got all breezy feature, artwork, etc.

body.para: I did a `gksudo "update-manager -d"` to upgrade my breezy to dapper, since the update-manager in breezy is now capable to upgrade to dapper and needs testing. http://thread.gmane.org/gmane.linux.ubuntu.devel/17268/focus=17268

It looks almost the same, like hoary or breezy before. I'm wondering what exciting new features and eyecandy of dapper (and of breezy before this upgrade?) I'm missing now. Some icons changed, the splash screen of course, and the programs are comming in their newer verions, though.
Is there a meta-package for dappers new features?
